sub_topic: Calculation of coefficient of performance of a heat pump
message_1: A heat pump operates between a cold reservoir at 5°C and a hot reservoir at 35°C. If the heat pump requires 1 kW of work to transfer heat from the cold reservoir to the hot reservoir at a rate of 3 kW, what is the coefficient of performance of the heat pump?
message_2:
The coefficient of performance (COP) of a heat pump is defined as the ratio of the heat transferred to the hot reservoir (Q_H) to the work input (W) required to operate the heat pump. Mathematically, it can be expressed as:

COP = Q_H / W

Given that the heat pump transfers heat from the cold reservoir to the hot reservoir at a rate of 3 kW (Q_H = 3 kW) and requires 1 kW of work (W = 1 kW) to operate, we can calculate the COP as follows:

COP = Q_H / W = 3 kW / 1 kW = 3

Therefore, the coefficient of performance of the heat pump is 3.
